values: Attempting to troubleshoot is terribly upsetting when I can't answer the person attempting to help me.  :(

I don't seem to regulate my body temperature well.  For as much as I like (visiting) snow, and as much as I DON'T particularly like Florida summers, I get cold easily. It's already starting a lil. :o  

I am considering taking apps from people who dun agitate me who are also willing to let me leach body heat for the winter to come. lol

Odd little things I've been saying lately.

Threats of pain/violence:
"[Go/I hope you] die in a fire."
"I am not above knocking you out, skinning you alive with a cheese grater, then drawing pictures on what's left with a sharpie."  (variant of something thiefed from the interwebz)
"I wish I had reason to think I could actually kick yer ass."

Being flattered:
"Aaaw, yer such a charming liar.  Bless yer heart."  (I've clearly been in the south too long)

On being the bigger person:
(assorted variants of) "Just once, I'd really love to get what I want, and say 'fuck the other guy' damnit. . ."

About men:
"Sometimes I just wanna lick 'em."
"I figured out why men are stupid.  Hormones make the IQ drop.  I need to stop hanging around decent guys who are also fun to look at.  It's new to me, I can't handle it!"

Misc:
"Yay!               What are we talking about?"

1  - Sleep is overrated. . .  says the one awake at 3:00am.  Tho I must admit, it's rather nice anyway.
2  - No matter how good my intentions are to take care of my car, it can and will break in some silly way.  Or not so silly, as the case often will be.
3  - The phrase "it wasn't meant to be" is bullshit almost always uttered by someone who a) was in a less then perfect situation they didn't wanna work through or b) said by someone who dun have the guts to come out and hurt someone directly.
4  - I'm posting this on livejournal, and it shows up on Facebook.  Kinda cool, huh?  Rawr.
5  - Earthquakes are not as bad as people who aren't used to them think they are.
6  - Hurricanes ARE as bad as people thing, cuz they are like clockwork every year. . .
7  - There is no shame in wanting others to be happy.  However, the right personality tpes need to learn to make themselves happy too.
8  - My cat Ritz wins at life.
9  - There will always be that one coworker you wouldn't mind having spontaneously combust.  Assuming of course they are far enough away to not be a mess in your work space.
10 - Melon is still a tad putrid.  It has no right to call itself a fruit and needs to be punished.

Tune in next week for more?  Maybe.

Okay, maybe not.

http://www.thinkgeek.com/geek-kids/1-3-years/b78f/

Humm. .   is it bad that a part of me wants those at age 26?

. . . got run over by a reindeer.  But that's alright, I can still wish you spazzes some stinkin' holiday joys. 

Here. . . have something foolish to watch till ya eat too much, tear open shiny boxes, and curse at bad drivers on your way to church for your Christmas event if ya participate in one.  ;p

- Pick 15 of your favorite movies.
- Go to IMDb and find a quote from each movie.
- Post them here for everyone to guess.
- Strike it out when someone guesses correctly, and put who guessed it and the movie.
- No Googling/using IMDb search functions!

Status: 13/15


 

1) From now on, the only person who gets to yell is me. Why? Because I have a gun. People with guns get to do whatever they want. Married people without guns - for instance - you - DO NOT get to yell. Why? NO GUNS! No guns, no yelling. See? Simple little equation. ()

2) You better pay for that pee-stick when you're done with it. Don't think it's yours just because you marked it with your urine! ()

3) Now which doll shall we give Daisy's little friend Emily? The one that looks like a transvestite or the one that looks like a dominatrix? ()

4) You ain't from this planet are you, Vincent? Who is gonna mug two black fellas, holding pistols, sat in a car that is worth less than your shirt? ()

5) Mother, I do not need a blind date. Particularly not with some verbally incontinent spinster who drinks like a fish, smokes like a chimney, and dresses like her mother. ()

6) Well, you know, when you want something really bad and you close your eyes and you wish for it? God's the guy that ignores you.

7) I'm going to sleep this off. Please let me know if there's some other way we can screw up tonight. ()

8) This is grain, which any fool can eat, but for which the Lord intended a more divine means of consumption. Let us give praise to our maker and glory to his bounty by learning about... BEER. ()

9) I'm not questioning your powers of observation, I'm merely remarking on the paradox of asking a masked man who he is. ()

10) I've never used the word 'spinster' in my life. Okay, once, when I told my mother it was technically incorrect to call her son a spinster.

11) No wonder your president has to be an actor, he's gotta look good on television. ()

12) You're going to find that many of the truths we cling to depend greatly on our own point of view. ()

13) I apologize for calling your wife a bloated warthog, and I bid you good day. ()

14) Whenever I'm in a room with a guy, no matter who it is - a date, my dentist, anybody - I think: If we were the last two people on Earth, would I puke if he kissed me? ()

15) We had part of a Slinky. But I straightened it. ()
I've been suckered into Facebook AND EmoSpace accounts within the last six months or so. Just curious if I'm the only one. ;p

So yeah.  I don't post here so much lately.  But!  After a quiet night of moderate forums lurking, I stumble across a reminder of a great truth?  Well, perhaps not GREAT, but it makes me laugh.  Either with or at the poster?  The world may never know. 

To Quote:
Whenever I get a package of plain M&Ms, I make it my duty to continue the strength and robustness of the candy as a species. To this end, I hold M&M duels.

Taking two candies between my thumb and forefinger, I apply pressure, squeezing them together until one of them breaks and splinters. That is the "loser," and I eat the inferior one immediately. The winner gets to go another round.

I have found that, in general, the brown and red M&Ms are tougher, and the newer blue ones are genetically inferior. I have hypothesized that the blue M&Ms as a race cannot survive long in the intense theater of competition that is the modern candy and snack-food world.

Occasionally I will get a mutation, a candy that is misshapen, or pointier, or flatter than the rest. Almost invariably this proves to be a weakness, but on very rare occasions it gives the candy extra strength. In this way, the species continues to adapt to its environment.

When I reach the end of the pack, I am left with one M&M, the strongest of the herd. Since it would make no sense to eat this one as well, I pack it neatly in an envelope and send it to M&M Mars, A Division of Mars, Inc., Hackettstown, NJ 17840-1503 U.S.A., along with a 3x5 card reading, "Please use this M&M for breeding purposes."

This week they wrote back to thank me, and sent me a coupon for a free 1/2 pound bag of plain M&Ms. I consider this "grant money." I have set aside the weekend for a grand tournament. From a field of hundreds, we will discover the True Champion.

There can be only one.

It was a day of music, fireworks, general foolishness with some friends, and a cute (I usually wouldn't have said it, but poor guy really did seem to need a hug) and stressed server at IHOP who I suspect we amused after a long day.  No complaints in the end really.  :)

Yes I am alive.  Though, it's late and I am sick, so this post might be horrid.  ;p

So anyway: more and more lately I catch myself feeling older.  It is fine and good since it IS known to happen to the best of us.  I can't be first person to feel it, and I HIGHLY doubt I'll be the last.  Though I have to say. . .I cant decide what bothers me exactly. . . that I don't have half of what I expected to have to show for my 25 years, or that what I don't have- I either lost, or just really could have by now had I been a bit more motivated or if a few key events had unfolded differently.  I'm not crying about it though, just reflecting and hoping to god I won't turn into a "woman of a certain age" in a few years.  I mean, really. . . my love life revolves around a perfectly charming and rather young non local.  Known 'em a few years, it's flattering as hell, and I love 'em to death and all. .  but where IS the line between playful flirtyness and something more anyway?  And even if we were both to think it's fine to cross it. .   is it REALLY the smart move right now?  I've rushed blindly before, and I didn't really get either of us too far.  (No offence if ya reading this Elbie- lol)  But yeah, my cute lil young'un. . . It's just a lil weird to put it mildly.  I won't even go into what other options have been.  I am starting to think I should just convert to Catholicism and see about becoming a Nun or some such sillyness.

Friends and relatives about my age (and younger) are starting to spawn.  And last I knew my Ex, his new girlfriend and her son are a happy family.  Not an envy point or anything. .  but wow.  Hot shit, right?  We are growing up.  :o  A lot of my old interests. .  are still THERE, just fading.  I'm prolly a special kind of boring lately since it doesn't seem like I'm forming too many new ones to take their places.

Next part?  I don't look at cars the same way so much anymore.  Not to say I WANT a gutless wonder that can't get up and move, but it's not fist think on my car priority list.  Maybe it's just the fact my last car and current are moodier than 15 year old girls, but I just want something reliable.  And gas efficiant.  Hell, I want a hybrid eventually.  I never wanted an all out sports car or anything, but what I look for now make me feel about 5 years older than I really am.  :o

Oh yeah, and I catch myself thinking I only moved to FL a few summers ago?  It's been like 11 years.  When the FUCK did that happen?  o.O  And I need a new comp when I get the chance.  Yay?  pppft.





Oh ya, if ya click that link, try to give it time.  It really is sorta funny in a fucked up way after a lil bit.  I thought so anyway.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vzgEi_u9-88

Didn't take me long at all to catch teh joke. ;p

In 2007, fallingphoenix resolves to...
Buy new friends.
Connect with my inner html.
Find a better confidence.
Go to love every Sunday.
Go flirting three times a week.
Backup my confusion regularly.
Get your own New Year's Resolutions:

Ha!  I found my iPod.  Hell, I found it all in one piece, and functional at that!  Rawr.

I have an interview for seasonal filler job while I continue to job hunt.  Laugh if ya want, but a girl's gotta do what a girl's gotta do until I get my ass back into classes. . .  again.  Fuuuuuck.

People I had nearly forgotten about are getting in touch with me a lot last few weeks.  Weird how they always come in groups. . .

And happy Thanksgiving (or 'happy be a glutton and conveniently forget we weren't here first day' as a few have stated lately) to those of you from/in the U.S.

Okay here we go. . .  I feel this has to be done.  Public documentation, so I can't be misquoted later and further made into a bad guy for the wrong reasons.  I'm used to being the one who's always wrong even if I am not, so whatever. . .  Just want to provide the accurate reason for people to think ill of me? heh   Sounds good enough.  

So!  People who know me in the real world, or at least know me well enough to know where to send emails. . .  PLEASE feel free to do so if you have anything to ask me.  Communication through a third party seems (to me at least) just a little bit disrespectful.  Only somewhat so to me, mind you.  But involving extra people?  Why?  There's no point to it if it is not required.  If by chance you feel that you shouldn't be asking me directly because you want to think I'd never respond in your favor, or I can't handle being civil, I want to suggest a trip to the closest mirror.  Perhaps it isn't just me you should worry about.  

So maybe that sentence wasn't so nice, but I can't say I enjoy hearing about possible assumptions people seem to make about me.  The way I see it, if people can't work up the nerve to ask anyone something directly (e-mail, aim, and telephone works versus a real life conversation if needed) then they don't deserve an answer.  This applies to anyone about anything, methinks.  

Just my two cents.

Heh. Okie. So I am out with tonigh last night, playing social and whatnot. Picked up a case for my camera, when I remembered something. . . still has my camera. So yeah. . . it has to be done: Gimme that back, foo! ;p Also remembered how much I adore a local Italian place that we had dinner at. Hehe. Then again, steak and shake with was yummy enough too at whatever weird hour that was. Sadly I was half asleep at the time for that one, so prolly more than a lil boring. Oops. I've decided I need to pester the Liz-monster though. Might be good for her. And I've been entirely too antisocial as of late. Though, even around people, I prolly still wont feel a need to talk about myself or my life much if I can avoid it. Remind me to thank folks for beating it into my head that simply venting isn't allowed and/or circumstances have forfeited my right to offer insight on some things. That last sentence prolly shouldn't have been mentioned. But I can't say that I care. ;p RANDOM BITS Ikaruga is a weird lil game. ;) Holy crap I got my druid full tier 1 in like. . 5 MC runs. o.O <3

Oh. Holy. Jesus. I can't decide if I should laugh or be disgusted. Didn't like that movie. Plus there's gonna be a million female bloodelves spawned within a few days doing theirs. Only NEKKID! >.< Other WoW players: You know it's true as well as I do. heh

Posting in recognition that I am indeed getting older. ;) But at least, this one was a little bit interesting. To me anyway. . . was tricky to make my picks. Some of the darker morbid stuff was more interesting though. lol Stolen from random non-livejournal bloger. Wikipedia Birthday Meme 1. Go to Wikipedia. 2. In the Search box, type your birth month and day (but not year). 3. List three events that happened on your birthday. 4. List two important birthdays and one interesting death. 5. Post it. My birthday is the 21st of June. Events: * 1947 - A seaman named Harold Dahl claims to have seen six UFOs near Maury Island, United States. The next morning Dahl reported the first modern Men in Black encounter. * 1989 - The U.S. Supreme Court rules in Texas v. Johnson that flag burning is protected speech under the United States Constitution. * 2001 - Jeff Skilling (Former Enron CEO) is hit in the face with a pie during a visit to California. (WHY was that even listed? lol) Births: * 1732 - Johann Christoph Friedrich Bach, German composer * 1905 - Jean-Paul Sartre, French philosopher and writer, Nobel Prize laureate (declined) Death: * 1591 - Aloysius Gonzaga, Italian saint

I don't remember who posted this, but I stole it from them. If you refuse to live your life in a way that feeds off of gossip or hearsay, and would much rather put fourth a bit of effort on occasion to get a few first hand statements, put this in your LJ.
